author: Vatican News
title: Pope to commemorate 2014 invocation for peace in Holy Land - Vatican News
text: Pope to commemorate 2014 invocation for peace in Holy Land By Deborah Castellano Lubov Ten years ago, Pope Francis organized a historic [invocation for peace](https://www.vatican.va/content/francesco/en/speeches/2014/june/documents/papa-francesco_20140608_invocazione-pace.html) in the Holy Land in the Vatican Gardens. Ten years on, as war devastates the region, he is set to renew his appeal with a momentous gesture. The commemoration will take place in the same place and on the same date, however, amid a totally devastated and devastating scenario, confirmed the Director of the Holy See Press Office, Matteo Bruni. On 8 June 2014, Pope Francis, the then-President of the State of Israel, Shimon Peres, the President of the State of Palestine, Mahmoud Abbas, and the Ecumenical Patriarch of Constantinople, Bartholomew I, made history in an unprecedented event in which the leaders planted an olive tree for peace and addressed those present in the Vatican Gardens. During that occasion, Pope Francis reminded the presidents that our world not only "is a legacy bequeathed to us from past generations," but also is "on loan to us from our children: our children who are weary, worn out by conflicts and yearning for the dawn of peace, our children who plead with us to tear down the walls of enmity and to set out on the path of dialogue and peace, so that love and friendship will prevail." In his remarks, the Holy Father also reaffirmed that peacemaking, "much more than warfare," calls for courage. "It calls for the courage to say yes to encounter and no to conflict: yes to dialogue and no to violence; yes to negotiations and no to hostilities; yes to respect for agreements and no to acts of provocation; yes to sincerity and no to duplicity. All of this takes courage, it takes strength and tenacity." The Pope had visited the Holy Land only a couple of months prior, where he had made a 24-26 May pilgrimage on the occasion of the 50th anniversary of the meeting between Pope St. Paul VI and then-Ecumenical Patriarch Athenagoras in Jerusalem. Now, Pope Francis renews his appeal for peace in the Lord's homeland more than ever. Salvatore Cernuzio contributed to this article. Thank you for reading our article. You can keep up-to-date by subscribing to our daily newsletter. [ Just click here](/en/newsletter-registration.html)

author: VNExplorer
title: Premier League: Las cinco claves de la derrota del Arsenal ante West Ham
text:
El Arsenal no pudo recuperar el liderato de la Premier League después de perder en casa ante el West Ham de Edson Álvarez. Estas son las claves.
El Arsenal desaprovechó un momento inmejorable para recuperar el liderato de la Premier League después de caer ante el West Ham en un partido que fue polémico y en el que los de Arteta no aprovecharon su superioridad en el campo.
1. Un gol polémico abrió el marcador Cuando mejor estaba jugando el Arsenal, apareció una jugada polémica cuando James Ward Prowse se encontró con un balón que parecía haber abandonado la línea. El silbante dejó seguir la jugada y Soucek aprovechó para de esa manera marcar el primer gol del partido.
2. Mohamed Kudus desespera al Arsenal Una de las principales razones que llevaron al West Ham a la victoria es el ghanés Mohamed Kudus, quien se lució con un partidazo en el Emirates Stadium. El africano estuvo atento a las coberturas, recuperando varios balones y desesperando al cuadro rival.
3. Poste de Bukayo Saka Un error del mexicano Edson Álvarez pudo haber sido catastrófico para el West Ham. Afortunadamente para el cuadro de David Moyes, Bukayo Saka no pudo aprovechar y terminó estrellando su disparo en el poste.
4. Mavropanos aplica la ley del ex Arsenal salió decidido a buscar el gol del empate en la segunda parte, pero recibieron nuevamente un golpe que terminó noqueando al cuadro de Arteta. A los 55 minutos, Mavropanos, quien pasó sin pena ni gloria con Arsenal, remató con la cabeza en un tiro de esquina para aplicar la ley del ex y complicar el panorama del Arsenal.
5. Contundencia del West Ham El planteamiento de David Moyes le terminó siendo exitoso al West Ham. A pesar de ceder el balón al rival, el cuadro de los ‘Hammers’ golpeó en dos de los tres tiros a puerta que tuvieron en el partido para llevarse los tres puntos.
Con el triunfo, el West Ham recuperó el sexto lugar al llegar a 33 puntos, mientras que el Arsenal se quedó con el segundo lugar al quedarse en 40 unidades, dos puntos menos que el Liverpool.
Sigue el canal de Diario AS en WhatsApp, donde encontrarás todas las claves deportivas del día.

author: @Midilibre
title: Le rêve bleu du peintre Dann aux cimaises de la chapelle des Capucins
text:
Le rêve bleu du peintre Dann aux cimaises de la chapelle des Capucins
La nouvelle exposition de peinture, actuellement à la chapelle des Capucins, accueille l’artiste Dann. Daniel Aubert, alias Dann, a son atelier à Sommières. Son goût pour la peinture lui vient de sa grand-mère "qui trouvait le temps de dessiner malgré le travail que lui donnaient ses neuf enfants". Il peint depuis une quarantaine d’années et a apporté ses conseils dans le domaine de la créativité aux Beaux-Arts de Saint-Étienne. Il se consacre à sa passion et d’années en années reçoit de nombreuses distinctions comme notamment des médailles d’or en Chine à Beijing (2015) et à Québec au Canada (2018). Très prolifique, il expose fréquemment dans tout l’hexagone et en Europe. Sa toute dernière exposition, qu’il a baptisée Dream in blue, rêve en bleu, illumine les cimaises de la chapelle aigues-mortaise. Influencés par les peintres impressionnistes et en particulier Émile Noirot, ses paysages intérieurs sont directement issus de ses rêves, dit-il. "J’imagine d’abord une couleur particulière que je vois dans mes pensées et quand je l’ai obtenue sur la toile, je laisse aller mon pinceau qui traduit mes sentiments intérieurs. Je ne peins pas la réalité mais plus tôt je la suggère", explique-t-il.
Des tons profonds comme la mer
Pour accentuer l’impression de profondeur et vitaliser ses tons, le coloriste utilise la peinture à l’huile qu’il mélange avec une peinture vitrail, un mélange dont il a le secret afin de tonifier ses ciels, ses vagues ou la transparence et la profondeur de ses mers. En témoignent ses toiles Humeur vagabonde, Détermination ou encore Nulle part, entre autres.
Correspondant Midi Libre : 06 81 79 48 55

author: NA
title: Vanity Fare: Start your year right and get squeaky clean with these body washes | The Star
text:
It is the first week of 2024, and what better way to kick start the new year by transforming your shower routine for the better?
The right body wash products can nourish skin and help give you that silky smooth feel. Take a look at the latest offerings and give your year a clean start.
Nourishing and rejuvenating
Sigi Skin's Calming Breeze Body Wash caters to all, featuring a subtle clean musk scent with hints of refreshing buttery peach.
Vegan-friendly, gentle for kids, and safe for eczema-prone skin, everyone can indulge in this product's tranquil benefits, crafted with a harmonious blend of ingredients which include alfalfa.
This protects the skin from premature ageing while easing redness and irritation.
Verbascoside, a plant stem cell derived from lilac, regulates sebum production and soothes acne thanks to its high antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory properties.
Rice helps to soothe sensitive skin, and ceramides fortify the skin's barrier, promoting a plump and firm complexion.
It also contains Glycerin that seals in moisture, leaving your skin feeling soft and nourished.
Gentle and effective
Illiyoon's Ceramide Ato Line is formulated specifically for sensitive Asian skin with several core ingredients.Yoon Complex, produced from the Asian herbal medicine “Senghyulyunbueum”, it includes ginseng water and bupleurum falcatum root.
Phytoceramide, which are plant-derived ceramides from black beans have a similar structure to the ceramides of various sizes found in the skin, aim at strengthening the skin barrier gently and effectively.
The Ceramide Skin Complex is made with high amounts of ceramides and fatty acids as well as cholesterol.
The brand's Ceramide Ato 6.0 Top To Toe Wash has a mild pH balancing formula for a gentle yet effective top to toe cleansing experience.
It can be used on the scalp, face and body while maintaining the skin's natural acidity for a healthy skin barrier.
Read more: Vanity Fare: Makeup must-haves to help achieve that dramatic yet flawless look
Ultimate hydration
The Li’bra by Libra Wellness Skin Balancing Body Wash is made up of avocado oil, broccoli extract and coconut, which are meant to restore balance in skin pH levels while leaving the skin hydrated and nourished.
Sulfate-free, vegan and suitable for all skin types, the wash was designed to remove impurities without over stripping and drying.
It has a citrus botanical scent top notes of passionfruit, grapefruit, pineapple, tangerine and big strawberry, while its middle notes are peony, vanilla orchid, red berries, jasmine and lily of the valley.
Its base notes are musk, woody notes and oakmoss.
Invigorating formula
Aesop's new Bar Soaps are a sudsy collection to cleanse, buff, and invigorate.
Named Refresh, Polish, and Nurture, these 150g slabs provide an effective and fragrant cleanse, leaving skin ready for hydration.
The Refresh soap is an invigorating, non-drying cleanse that purifies without drying the skin and is created with a blend of lime, bergamot rind and ylang ylang that lends it a citrus, floral and fresh aroma.
Polish, a gentle exfoliation soap bar that has a green, camphoraceous character, is curated with a combination of grape seed and finely milled pumice, as well as sage leaf, pine needle and clove bud, suitable for most skin types but mainly for dry or patchy skin.
Nurture is a mild, non-perturbing cleanse ideal for dry skin. Created with rosemary leaf, cedar atlas and lavender stem, it leaves a woody, herbaceous aroma on the skin.
Read more: Flaxseed beauty masks are seen as the homemade Botox, but do they work?
An earthy solution
Salt & Stone's Santal & Vetiver Body Wash is a multi-benefit, refreshing gel body cleanser with antioxidant-rich seaweed extracts and natural hydrating ingredients designed to restore skin exposed to the elements.
The product is meant to soften and soothe while cleansing to reverse the drying effects of outdoor activity, wind, sun and sea.
Its scent combines Australian sandalwood with a dominant cedarwood accord, and is supplemented by an earthy vetiver note with a backdrop of warm amber.
Containing seaweed extracts and spirulina, these antioxidant-rich ocean botanicals soothe irritated skin exposed to the elements, while niacinamide creates a stronger, healthy skin barrier while improving the look of skin texture.
